title: Sustainable side-stream management in Swedish food processing companies using external actors and biogas solutions - Frontiers
summary: The article explores the management of side-streams in food processing companies to enhance sustainability by upcycling bio-residuals into high-value products. It investigates how these companies prefer external actors for managing side-streams rather than investing in technology themselves, with a focus on biogas solutions. The study reveals a shift towards more sustainable practices and identifies biogas as a versatile and essential element in side-stream management.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses innovations in managing side-streams in food processing companies to enhance sustainability by upcycling bio-residuals into high-value products, aligning with the principles of green innovation.
business_innovation: FALSE - The article does not primarily focus on new or improved products or business processes that differ significantly from the firm's previous offerings, but rather on sustainable practices in side-stream management.
green_product: FALSE - The article does not specifically focus on the design, manufacturing, and usage of goods or services that significantly reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycles.
green_process: TRUE - The article discusses methods in managing side-streams in food processing companies that aim to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability, making it a green process innovation.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325199 - All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing, 325211 - Plastics Material and Resin Manufacturing, 325311 - Nitrogenous Fertilizer Manufacturing, 562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it provides a genuine exploration of sustainability practices and biogas solutions in food processing companies.

title: interzum 2023 exceeds organizers expectations - woodworkingnetwork.com
summary: The trade fair interzum 2023 in Cologne showcased innovative solutions and new products focused on sustainability and environmental issues, attracting around 62,000 trade visitors from nearly 150 countries.

green_product: TRUE: The article mentions that many of the products showcased at the trade fair were designed with sustainability, resource efficiency, and environmental impact minimization in mind. This aligns with the definition of a green product, emphasizing reduced environmental impact throughout the product's life cycle.
green_process: TRUE: The article discusses the focus on sustainability, resource efficiency, and environmental considerations in the manufacturing and operational activities at the trade fair. title: Movitec Joins EAM-Mosca: A New Era in Stretch Wrap Systems - Canada NewsWire
summary: EAM-Mosca introduces Movitec rotary ring stretch wrapping machines to enhance end-of-line packaging solutions, highlighting the innovative designs and advanced technology of Movitec. The partnership aims to provide comprehensive packaging solutions to new markets in the US, Canada, Mexico, and Latin America, emphasizing efficiency and reliability in securing goods for transport.
green_innovation: FALSE. The article does not emphasize environmental sustainability goals or the reduction of negative environmental externalities as key drivers of the innovation.
business_innovation: TRUE. The addition of Movitec rotary ring stretch wrapping machines to EAM-Mosca's product portfolio represents a new and improved product innovation aimed at enhancing end-of-line packaging solutions, differing significantly from previous offerings.
green_product: FALSE. While the Movitec rotary ring stretch wrapping machines may have some environmental benefits in terms of product functionalities, the article does not focus on significantly reducing environmental impact throughout the products' life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. The article discusses the innovative designs and advanced technology of Movitec's rotary ring stretch wrapping machines, which aim to minimize environmental impacts in manufacturing and production activities, promoting sustainability through efficient packaging processes.
